ovdesc.p: This table is used to capture the outward transaction details and also information that is carried by the Addenda type record for incoming file, that is the one with the file type indicator '7'. This record is optional and the availability and number of records depends on the SEC codes for which the transaction was made.
The details on the record include additional information related to the entry raised.

For the incoming entries, the table is updated by retreiving details from the incoming file and the same is updated and used to construct the NACHA compliant output file in case of outward entries and returned entries.

desc.p: The key of this table is the same as the ACH.ENTRY table in case of incoming entries and in case of an outgoing transaction, it is the same as the FT transaction id.
Specifies whether the entry is posted for either incoming or outgoing messages.
Allowed values are OUTWARD and INWARD
The field carries the standard entry class code type which uniquely identifies the class of the ACH transactions made.
The following are the various SEC codes
These are picked up from the EB.LOOKUP table and hence needs an entry in the same.
Identifies the type of the record. As per the NACHA format, the file structure has different types of records which are identified by the codes as given below.

p.p: Maximum of 1 character, as the table carries the addenda record, the value is always 7.

desc.p: The field carries the addenda type code which helps in identifying the type of information contained in the addenda record.
02 - Used for the POS, MTE and SHR standard
entry classes. The Addenda information is used for
05 - Used for CCD, CTX and PPD standard entry
98 - Used for Notification of Change entries. The
addenda record contains the correct information.
Information related to payment is updated in this field.
Indicates the sequence of the addenda record attached to the entry being processed. The first addenda record is given the value of 1, followed by 2,3 etc sequentially.
Entry sequence number is the same as the last 7 digits of the Trace number of the related entry detail record. This helps in tracing the addenda records pertaining to the detail record.

When a transaction between two different currencies is processed, the amount for which the entry is to be received is updated in the Foreign Payment amount field, expressed in terms of the destination currency.
Identifies the receiver of the transaction. This could either be the receiving company's name or an identification number of the same. The field is useful for descriptive purposes.
The field contains the name of the originator of the transaction.
Contains the address of the Originator of the transaction.
Contains the name of the city to which the Originator of the transaction belongs.
Carries the name of the Originating DFI.
This field contains the code that identifies the numbering scheme used in the orgiinating DFI identification number field.
The field contains the routing number of the DFI Originiting the entries.
Carries the code of the country in which the originator is located. The two charactered code, approved by the International Organisation for Standardization (ISO) identifies the country.
Contains the name of the Receiving Depository Financial Institution.
This field contains the code that identifies the numbering scheme used in the receiving DFI identification number field.
The field contains the routing number of the DFI in which the receiver holds an account.
Carries the code of the country in which the receiving bank is located. The two charactered code, approved by the International Organisation for Standardization (ISO) identifies the country.

Identifies the receiver and is used for descriptive purposes.
Validation Rule:
Upto 15 characters

t.desc:
Holds information on the address of the receiver.
Validation Rule: Maxiumum 35 characters

Holds information on the city / town / province to which the receiver belongs.
Validation Rule: Maxiumum 35 characters

desc.p: Holds information on the country and the postal code of the receiver.
The field carries the name of the Foreign Correspondent Bank Name.

t.desc:
This field contains the code that identifies the numbering scheme used in the Foreign Correspondent Bank identification number field. The possible values are 01 - National Clearing System Number 02 - BIC code 03 -IBAN
Validation Rule:
Maximum of 2 characters

desc.p: This field contains the bank identification number of the Foreign Correspondent Bank

Carries the code of the country in which the Foreign Correspondent bank is located. The two charactered code, approved by the International Organisation for Standardization (ISO) identifies the country.
This field aids in identifying an ATM network in order to allow processing of entries between DFIs belonging to a different network.

The terminal ID code is unique to the Electronic terminal and allows a terminal owner or a switching network to identify the origination terminal of the entries.
Validation Rule:
Maximum of 6 characters
Holds the sequential number that is assigned by the terminal at the time of transaction generation.
The date on which the transaction occurred.
The time at which the transaction originated for the day is updated in the TXN.TIME field.
The field identifies the specific location of the terminal.
This field identifies the city, town, village or township in which an Electronic terminal is located. In case of inward entries, the value for the field is received from the incoming file.
This field identifies the state of the United States in which an Electronic terminal is located. In case of inward entries, the value for the field is received from the incoming file.
The field carries a trace number assigned by the Bank. This number is unique to every transaction and can be used to identify a transaction in case of an inquiry.
Additional reference field to identify transactions with numbers or codes.
Additional reference field to identify transactions with numbers or codes.
Incase of returned entries, the addenda record carries the trace number of the original entries. This is useful in case of inquiry to trace transactions.
This field is not used currently.
Incase of returned entries, the field is updated with the identification of the original receiving DFI which was originally included in the entries.
Identifies the various types of debit and credit entries. The possible values are

52 - Loan Accoutn Credit
Validation Rule: Mandatory field,
Upto 3 characters is allowed

Holds the value of the sort code of the bank through which clearing is being done. Incase of the inward entries, the value is received from the incoming file and for the outward entries, the value for this field is fetched from the application BC.SORT.CODE
Holds the name of the beneficiary of the transaction.

t.desc:
Holds the receiver's account number at their financial institution.
Validation Rule: Mandatory field,
Upto 17 characters

desc.p: This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type ADV.

Holds the value of the sort code of the bank through which clearing is being done. Incase of the inward entries, the value is received from the incoming file and for the outward entries, the value for this field is fetched from the application BC.SORT.CODE
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type ADV
Holds the value of the key of the record ACH.FILE file for which the entries are posted. This is also the first part of the @ID of the ACH.ENTRIES file itself.
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type POP
This field carries the check serial number from the eligible source document to which the entry relates to.

t.desc:
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type SHR.
Holds the expiry date of the card. This is useful in verifying the validity of the card for various security and authorisation procedures.
Validation Rule: Date format

desc.p: This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type .
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type ACK,ATX, XCK,RCK, ARC, TRC
This field carries the check serial number from the eligible source document to which the entry relates to.
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type TRC
Carries the optional code which is used to identify the document type.
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type TRC
Contains the MICR locator number for Check item research.
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type TRC
This field carries the code that indicates the type of items being truncated.
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type CTX, ENR, TRX, CCD, ATX.
Identifies the receiver of the transaction. This could either be the receiving company's name or an identification number of the same. The field is useful for descriptive purposes.

t.desc:
This field is used for outward entries, where the addenda details have to be given. Used for the sec type RCK,ARC, BOC Identifies the receiver of the transaction. This could either be the receiving company's name or an identification number of the same. The field is useful for descriptive purposes.
Validation Rule:
Maximum of 22 characters

desc.p: This field is not used currently.

t.desc:
The field indicates whether an addenda record is available for the transaction. If there is no addenda available then the value is '0' and if there is an addenda record available then the value updated is '1'.
Validation Rule: Possible values are 0 and 1

desc.p:
This field is updated for company's internal use if required.
Validation Rule: Though not specified with any particular format, allowed
Upto 2 characters
